018package com.scivicslab.actoriac.cli;
019
020import java.io.File;
021import java.io.IOException;
022import java.io.InputStream;
023import java.nio.file.Files;
024import java.nio.file.Path;
025import java.util.Comparator;
026import java.util.List;
027import java.util.concurrent.Callable;
028import java.util.logging.LogManager;
029import java.util.stream.Collectors;
030import java.util.stream.Stream;
031
032import picocli.CommandLine;
033import picocli.CommandLine.Command;
034import picocli.CommandLine.Option;
035
036/**
037 * Main command-line interface for actor-IaC.
038 *
039 * <p>This is the entry point for all actor-IaC commands. Use subcommands to
040 * execute specific operations:</p>
041 *
042 * <h2>Subcommands</h2>
043 * <ul>
044 *   <li>{@code run} - Execute workflows</li>
045 *   <li>{@code list} - List available workflows</li>
046 *   <li>{@code describe} - Describe workflow structure</li>
047 *   <li>{@code logs} - Query execution logs</li>
048 *   <li>{@code log-server} - Start H2 log server</li>
049 *   <li>{@code db-clear} - Clear (delete) the log database</li>
050 * </ul>
051 *
052 * <h2>Usage Examples</h2>
053 * <pre>
054 * actor-iac run -d ./workflows -w deploy
055 * actor-iac list -d ./workflows
056 * actor-iac logs --db ./logs --list
057 * actor-iac log-server --db ./logs
058 * </pre>
059 *
060 * @author devteam@scivics-lab.com
061 * @since 2.7.0
062 */
063@Command(
064    name = "actor-iac",
065    mixinStandardHelpOptions = true,
066    version = "actor-IaC 2.12.1",
067    description = "Infrastructure as Code workflow automation tool.",
068    subcommands = {
069        RunCLI.class,
070        ListWorkflowsCLI.class,
071        DescribeCLI.class,
072        LogsCLI.class,
073        LogServerCLI.class,
074        MergeLogsCLI.class,
075        DbClearCLI.class
076    }
077)
078public class WorkflowCLI implements Callable<Integer> {
079
080    /**
081     * Main entry point.
082     *
083     * @param args command line arguments
084     */
085    public static void main(String[] args) {
086        // Load logging configuration from resources
087        try (InputStream is = WorkflowCLI.class.getResourceAsStream("/logging.properties")) {
088            if (is != null) {
089                LogManager.getLogManager().readConfiguration(is);
090            }
091        } catch (IOException e) {
092            System.err.println("Warning: Failed to load logging.properties: " + e.getMessage());
093        }
094
095        int exitCode = new CommandLine(new WorkflowCLI()).execute(args);
096        System.exit(exitCode);
097    }
098
099    /**
100     * Called when no subcommand is specified.
101     * Shows help message.
102     */
103    @Override
104    public Integer call() {
105        System.out.println("actor-IaC - Infrastructure as Code workflow automation tool");
106        System.out.println();
107        System.out.println("Usage: actor-iac <command> [options]");
108        System.out.println();
109        System.out.println("Commands:");
110        System.out.println("  run          Execute a workflow");
111        System.out.println("  list         List available workflows");
112        System.out.println("  describe     Describe workflow structure");
113        System.out.println("  log-search   Search execution logs");
114        System.out.println("  log-serve    Start H2 log server for centralized logging");
115        System.out.println("  log-merge    Merge scattered log databases into one");
116        System.out.println();
117        System.out.println("Examples:");
118        System.out.println("  actor-iac run -w sysinfo/main-collect-sysinfo.yaml -i inventory.ini");
119        System.out.println("  actor-iac run -d ./sysinfo -w main-collect-sysinfo.yaml -i inventory.ini");
120        System.out.println("  actor-iac list -w sysinfo");
121        System.out.println("  actor-iac describe -w sysinfo/main-collect-sysinfo.yaml");
122        System.out.println("  actor-iac log-search --db ./logs --list");
123        System.out.println("  actor-iac log-serve --db ./logs/shared");
124        System.out.println();
125        System.out.println("Use 'actor-iac <command> --help' for more information about a command.");
126        return 0;
127    }
128}
129
130/**
131 * Subcommand to list workflows discovered under a directory.
132 */
133@Command(
134    name = "list",
135    mixinStandardHelpOptions = true,
136    version = "actor-IaC list 2.12.1",
137    description = "List workflows in the specified directory."
138)
139class ListWorkflowsCLI implements Callable<Integer> {
140
141    @Option(
142        names = {"-d", "--dir"},
143        description = "Base directory. Defaults to current directory.",
144        defaultValue = "."
145    )
146    private File baseDir;
147
148    @Option(
149        names = {"-w", "--workflow"},
150        required = true,
151        description = "Workflow directory path (relative to -d)"
152    )
153    private String workflowPath;
154
155    @Override
156    public Integer call() {
157        File workflowDir = new File(baseDir, workflowPath);
158        if (!workflowDir.isDirectory()) {
159            System.err.println("Not a directory: " + workflowDir);
160            return 1;
161        }
162
163        List<WorkflowDisplay> displays = scanWorkflowsForDisplay(workflowDir);
164        if (displays.isEmpty()) {
165            System.out.println("No workflow files found in " + workflowDir.getPath());
166            return 0;
167        }
168
169        System.out.println("Workflows in " + workflowDir.getPath() + ":");
170        System.out.println("-".repeat(66));
171        System.out.printf("%-35s %s%n", "-w", "Description");
172        System.out.println("-".repeat(66));
173        for (WorkflowDisplay display : displays) {
174            String description = display.description() != null ? display.description() : "(no description)";
175            // Truncate description if too long
176            if (description.length() > 30) {
177                description = description.substring(0, 27) + "...";
178            }
179            // Show the path relative to base for use with run command
180            String relPath = workflowPath + "/" + display.fileName();
181            System.out.printf("%-35s %s%n", relPath, description);
182        }
183        return 0;
184    }
185
186    private static List<WorkflowDisplay> scanWorkflowsForDisplay(File directory) {
187        if (directory == null) {
188            return List.of();
189        }
190
191        // Non-recursive scan - only files in immediate directory
192        try (Stream<Path> paths = Files.list(directory.toPath())) {
193            return paths.filter(Files::isRegularFile)
194                 .filter(path -> {
195                     String name = path.getFileName().toString().toLowerCase();
196                     return name.endsWith(".yaml") || name.endsWith(".yml")
197                         || name.endsWith(".json") || name.endsWith(".xml");
198                 })
199                 .map(path -> {
200                     File file = path.toFile();
201                     return new WorkflowDisplay(file.getName(), extractDescription(file));
202                 })
203                 .sorted(Comparator.comparing(WorkflowDisplay::fileName, String.CASE_INSENSITIVE_ORDER))
204                 .collect(Collectors.toList());
205        } catch (IOException e) {
206            System.err.println("Failed to scan workflows: " + e.getMessage());
207            return List.of();
208        }
209    }
210
211    private static String extractDescription(File file) {
212        String fileName = file.getName().toLowerCase();
213        if (fileName.endsWith(".yaml") || fileName.endsWith(".yml")) {
214            return extractDescriptionFromYaml(file);
215        } else if (fileName.endsWith(".json")) {
216            return extractDescriptionFromJson(file);
217        }
218        return null;
219    }
220
221    private static String extractDescriptionFromYaml(File file) {
222        try (java.io.BufferedReader reader = new java.io.BufferedReader(new java.io.FileReader(file))) {
223            String line;
224            StringBuilder description = new StringBuilder();
225            boolean inDescription = false;
226            while ((line = reader.readLine()) != null) {
227                if (inDescription) {
228                    // Multi-line description handling
229                    if (line.startsWith("  ") || line.startsWith("\t")) {
230                        description.append(line.trim()).append(" ");
231                    } else if (line.trim().isEmpty()) {
232                        continue;
233                    } else {
234                        break;
235                    }
236                } else if (line.trim().startsWith("description:")) {
237                    String value = line.substring(line.indexOf(':') + 1).trim();
238                    if (value.equals("|") || value.equals(">")) {
239                        // Multi-line literal or folded
240                        inDescription = true;
241                    } else if (!value.isEmpty()) {
242                        // Inline description
243                        if ((value.startsWith("\"") && value.endsWith("\"")) ||
244                            (value.startsWith("'") && value.endsWith("'"))) {
245                            value = value.substring(1, value.length() - 1);
246                        }
247                        return value;
248                    }
249                }
250                if (line.trim().startsWith("steps:") || line.trim().startsWith("vertices:")) {
251                    break;
252                }
253            }
254            String result = description.toString().trim();
255            return result.isEmpty() ? null : result;
256        } catch (IOException e) {
257            // Ignore
258        }
259        return null;
260    }
261
262    private static String extractDescriptionFromJson(File file) {
263        try (java.io.FileReader reader = new java.io.FileReader(file)) {
264            org.json.JSONTokener tokener = new org.json.JSONTokener(reader);
265            org.json.JSONObject json = new org.json.JSONObject(tokener);
266            return json.optString("description", null);
267        } catch (Exception e) {
268            // Ignore
269        }
270        return null;
271    }
272
273    private static record WorkflowDisplay(String fileName, String description) {}
274}
